intro: Sauvagesia africana, commonly known as the African sauvagesia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant has limited commercial use but is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
